issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
In some stack churn (create a stack with 2 instances and each attach a volume then delete the stack and create again) Null Pointer Exceptions are thrown. At this point I'm not sure if it's because 2 deletes of the same stack came in too quick or if the fact that the stack's resources never came to fruition prior to the delete.

Exceptions observed (full cloud-output.log and snippet with the error range attached).

fields.summary: CloudFormation stack churn can lead to NPE

comments.body: This is due to trying to do concurrent operations on a stack (delete while creating or delete while deleting).  With SWF we will be able to handle this case and detect it, but for now we fix it by throwing an error if a delete is attempted while another operation is going on (create/delete/rollback).  This is different from AWS.  If a stack is stuck in an operation, after 1 hour with no progress, we will allow the delete request to continue.
I'm having trouble doing something that causes the stack to be "busy". Therefore it is hard to start another action while the 1st is still going on.
